quiz.question: Which company uses headquarters in Cupertino, California?
Which company pioneered the app-store model on iOS and established a 70/30 revenue split?
Which company produces the electric cars Model S, 3, X, and Y?
Which company operates the advertising platform AdSense and AdWords?
Which company first introduced the concept of 'Prime Day' as a global shopping event?
Which company owns LinkedIn after a 2016 acquisition?
Which Chinese company is often called the 'Amazon of China'?
Which company held an early investment that turned into ownership of Twitter's competitor, ByteDance's TikTok interests?
Which company owns the Google search engine brand?
Which company acquired GitHub for $7.5 billion in 2018?
Which company announced a takeover bid for ARM in 2020 valued at around $40 billion?
Which retailer is the world's largest by revenue?
Which company launched Shopify to help merchants build online stores starting in 2006?
Which company completed acquisition of ARM's rival technologies after a failed Nvidia deal?
